text: Oroya is a genus of cacti (family Cactaceae), originating from Peru. The name comes from the Peruvian town of la Oroya where the first plants were discovered.http://www.cactiguide.com/cactus/?genus=Oroya Oroya species are solitary with a globular form and many ribs with usually-dense pectinate spines. Usually up to 13 inches (32 cm) high, and 9 inches (22 cm) in diameter. Small flowers (up to 1 cm in diameter) grow along a ring near the top of the plant. The flowers are yellow, but their stems are often pink or red. ==Species== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Image !! Scientific name !!
